content.text:
[@agentofuser](@/6Xvv3L7eYrQDsJQQkhcxf1G8xaP9HIj4LDqAJmYXyw=.ed25519) 

I think that's an improvement over using Chrome, but my goal is to reduce my dependence on Google overall. It's like Android: it's open source, but the vast majority of people who have knowledge/influence in the platform work at Google. I might be more comfortable with Brave in the future, but currently it seems like they've just added a cherry on top of a mountain of Google's codebase.

Maybe it's a silly goal, especially as I use Node.js pretty often (and am writing this via Electron), but I think/hope that the future will be full of sustainable software that's managed by communities rather than corporations.
